intro: Nassauvia pentacaenoides, commonly known as the mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an attractive choice for xeriscaping and native plant gardens.
